input_text:
Job Title: Willow Logistics Specialist – Bulk Materials - Logistics Specialist III

Location: Anchorage, AK

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Assignment Scope

This is a ConocoPhillips contingent worker (contractor) Anchorage based position working an office based 9/80 schedule. Travel to Fairbanks, the North Slope or other material staging locations can be expected about 20% of the time.

The role will report to the Willow Logistics Manager based in Anchorage and will work in close collaboration with the Willow Logistics Team based in Anchorage and the North Slope. Close collaboration is also required with other Willow construction staff and support contractors.

Key Roles And Responsibilities

Daily activities will include:

 Day-to-Day tasking from and support to the Willow Logistics Manager and Logistics Planner Liaison with other ConocoPhillips personnel and contractors in support of Willow objectives. Provide specialist level support for scheduling, transportation and staging of project construction materials. Troubleshooting and support to logistics service contractors as needed Responding to dynamic changes during construction activities Inspection and receipt of materials as required. Preparation of any required reports Leading or supporting any investigations into logistics or material related concerns.

HSE

 Proactively lead HSE performance by communicating, fostering, supporting, and enforcing HSE policies procedures, guidelines, requirements, and objectives Perform HSE engagements and interventions with contracted service providers if required Implement and support the COPA Incident Free Culture (IFC) program with contractors through participation in IFC workshops and field engagements Continuously demonstrates strong adherence to Company SPIRIT values

Qualification Requirements

Basic / Required:

 5+ years oil and gas experience to include Greenfields/brownfields major project construction Current/valid driver’s license Willing and able (with or without reasonable accommodation) to travel several days at a time.

:

 5+ years direct logistics related experience on the North Slope or elsewhere in Alaska Knowledge of existing COP North Slope operating practices and contract relationships Experience with SAP material tracking and receiving Advanced level interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills Advanced level multi-tasking skills with ability to manage multiple ongoing activities Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively within a team and across organizational boundaries Ability to synthesize data and develop suitable quantitative models to support logistics strategies and planning. Drives thoughtful and pragmatic change, encourages innovative thinking and continuous improvement Models adaptability through resourcefulness, flexibility, and positivity

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Willow Logistics Specialist – Bulk Materials - Logistics Specialist III
output_json.summary: An Anchorage-based full-time position requiring 5+ years of oil and gas experience, particularly in logistics.
job_responsibilities: Supports the Willow Logistics Manager and Logistics Planner.
Liaises with other ConocoPhillips personnel and contractors.
Provides specialist support for scheduling, transportation, and staging of project construction materials.
Troubleshoots and supports logistics service contractors.
Responds to dynamic changes during construction activities.
Leads or supports investigations into logistics or material-related concerns.

other.content: 5+ years oil and gas experience, including Greenfields/brownfields major project construction, current/valid driver’s license, willingness to travel several days at a time.
